title: Afghanistan education: Taliban running out of excuses - Malala
description: As some universities reopen in Afghanistan, Nobel Prize laureate Malala Yousafzai spoke to the BBC.

title: Havana Syndrome may be caused by ‘directed energy’
description: A new intelligence report provides another twist in the long-running mystery of US officials falling sick.

title: The families fighting to shut down suicide websites
description: The Samaritans charity says the government’s new online safety bill “isn’t fit for purpose”.

title: Levelling up: 'It's always promises but hopefully it will happen'
description: What do people in areas identified as being in need of "levelling up" really think of the plans?

title: Covid: Insights from deliberate infections and shop prices rise
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Wednesday evening.

title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang: Barcelona confirm signing on free transfer
description: Barcelona confirm the signing of Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang on a free transfer.

title: Households to get £200 help to ease energy bill rise
description: A government loan package will mean a £200 cut in household bills - but the money will have to be repaid.

title: Kate takes over from Harry as royal rugby patron
description: The Duchess of Cambridge visited a Twickenham training session as she became England's rugby patron.

title: Priti Patel 'sickened' by Charing Cross police behaviour
description: The home secretary condemns culture of misogyny and discrimination at Met Police uncovered in a report.

title: Ukraine tensions: US trying to draw Russia into war, Putin says
description: Russia's leader criticises the US and Nato amid tensions over his military build-up near Ukraine.

title: Swansea riot: 27 people charged over Mayhill disorder
description: The accused are aged 15 to 44, and include two also charged with arson with intent to endanger life.

title: No evidence for Boris Johnson's claim about Keir Starmer and Jimmy Savile
description: The PM's claim that Keir Starmer failed to prosecute Jimmy Savile is not backed up by any evidence.

title: Ecuador: Rescue efforts after heavy rain triggers Quito landslide
description: At least 24 people have died after rainfall reaches 20-year-high in the capital, Quito.

title: HRT product could be available over the counter
description: Women may be able to access a form of hormone replacement therapy in a pharmacy instead of at their GP.

title: Stolen Roman statue returned to France after 50 years
description: The statue of the god Bacchus is traced by a Dutch art detective and returned to a French museum.

title: Highlights: England beat Afghanistan to reach Under-19s Cricket World Cup final
description: Watch highlights as the England Under-19s men's team beat Afghanistan in a thrilling semi-final to reach the final of the U19 Cricket World Cup for the first time in 24 years.

title: Mason Greenwood: Man Utd footballer released on bail
description: The 20-year-old striker was arrested on suspicion of rape, sexual assault and making threats to kill.

title: David Goodwillie: Signing could be 'devastating' for women's football
description: The chief executive of Scottish Women's Football has criticised Raith Rovers' "poor" decision to sign David Goodwillie.

title: 'I've signed an NDA' - Westwood refuses to discuss proposed Saudi super league
description: Lee Westwood refuses to discuss a proposed Saudi Arabian-backed golf super league after signing a non-disclosure agreement.

title: 'Levelling up' plan unveiled for UK
description: The government gives itself until 2030 to improve transport, business, housing and education.

title: Laureus Awards: Emma Raducanu one of six British nominees
description: US Open champion Emma Raducanu is one of six British sports stars nominated for the 2022 Laureus World Sports Awards.

title: Adele announces she will perform at the Brit Awards
description: The star will also give her first interview since postponing her Las Vegas residency.

title: Colin the Caterpillar cake row crumbles
description: Marks & Spencer and Aldi reach a settlement in a copyright row over caterpillar cakes.

title: The Papers: Billions lost in 'scandalous' pandemic PPE waste
description: The government's decision to write off nearly £9bn lost on PPE features in some papers.

title: Winter Olympics: Who are the global names to watch at Beijing 2022?
description: Who is set to shine in Beijing? We take a look at the global names who are tipped to make the headlines at the 2022 Winter Olympics.

title: Calls to allow people to return to Edinburgh's Radical Road
description: One of Scotland's most historic paths has been closed for three years after a 50 tonne rock fall.

title: Banksy: Season’s Greetings could be broken up for move
description: Actor Michael Sheen said it is the "old story" of items with real value being moved over the border.

title: Winter Olympics: Matt Edmondson and Mollie King go head-to-head in curling challenge
description: Radio 1 presenters Mollie King and Matt Edmondson go head-to-head in a curling challenge.

title: Climate change: The science briefing that convinced Boris Johnson
description: The prime minister has called the presentation "very important' - now we get to see it.

title: Climate change: UK plants now flowering a month earlier
description: If flowers continue to appear earlier as the planet warms, there are risks for farming and nature.

title: Mitski quit music... and coming back fills her with dread
description: Indie star Mitski was called the artist of her generation - but success filled her with dread.

title: What next for Wordle and its fans?

title: Woman humiliated by police strip order
description: The case of a woman who was sat naked in a cell prompts calls for officers to be more understanding of minorities.

title: Education: Longer school day trial begins in Wales
description: Groups of pupils at 13 schools and one college will trial five extra hours of work a week.

title: Metal detecting teen's top tips to find treasure
description: Milly shares advice on being successful at metal detecting after uncovering a Bronze Age axe hoard.

title: Expelled while pregnant, now determined to learn

title: Ulysses: Celebrating 100 years of a literary masterpiece
description: The world marks the centenary of James Joyce's Ulysses, but the novel wasn't always celebrated.
